revised_title: X-ray Investigation of Synthetic Polypeptides' Structure
tldr: The authors investigated the structure of synthetic polypeptides using X-ray diffraction on oriented fibers and films. They discovered that polypeptides can exist in a folded (a) and an extended (P) configuration. The findings on the a-form are consistent with the presence of a twofold screw axis in symmetrical polypeptides, leading to a value of about 5.5 Å for the true fiber repeat distance. The transformation between the a and P forms is influenced by the medium from which the peptide is regenerated.
